learningOutcomes.fi:
The course aims to introduce basic project management methodology, management approaches for project-based corporations and give basic understanding on project business. After the course students: - Can identify and evaluate internal and external factors affecting a single project
- Know basic project management methodologies and concepts and can apply them in simple project environment
- Can connect projects and project portfolios to strategic management in companies
- Can classify and evaluate success factors of project business

content.fi: Project work concepts and methods. Project planning and control, project marketing and sales, projects in an organisation, project portfolio mangement, project oriented business in a corporation. Knowledge areas, methods and applications of project work, sustaibability and responsibility in project management.

name.fi: Case Studies in Sustainable Business D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Case Studies in Sustainable Business D, Föreläsning
name.en: Case Studies in Sustainable Business D, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures with a case study and a thematic teaching session. Also, weekly exercises.
workload.sv: Lectures with a case study and a thematic teaching session. Also, weekly exercises.
workload.en: Lectures with a case study and a thematic teaching session. Also, weekly exercises.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Understand the disruptive forces behind the sustainability transition and adopt a strategic framework for leading and designing for sustainable growth.
Familiarise yourself with the key concepts and demystify terminology related to sustainable business.
Understand what professional role you could play in designing and building sustainable products, services and organizations.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Understand the disruptive forces behind the sustainability transition and adopt a strategic framework for leading and designing for sustainable growth.
Familiarise yourself with the key concepts and demystify terminology related to sustainable business.
Understand what professional role you could play in designing and building sustainable products, services and organizations.
learningOutcomes.en:
Understand the disruptive forces behind the sustainability transition and adopt a strategic framework for leading and designing for sustainable growth.
Familiarise yourself with the key concepts and demystify terminology related to sustainable business.
Understand what professional role you could play in designing and building sustainable products, services and organizations.

content.fi: The course consists of case studies from businesses on how they have tranformed their strategies and operations to suit the transition to a more clean and just world. In addition, the course goes over each of the themes of the case company.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: MS-C1300 Complex Analysis MS-C1350 Partial Differential Equations OR MS-C1420 Fourier-analyysi MS-C1541 Metric SpacesRecommended prerequisites: MS-E1280 Measure and Integral OR MS-E1600 Probability Theory
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: MS-C1300 Complex Analysis MS-C1350 Partial Differential Equations OR MS-C1420 Fourier-analyysi MS-C1541 Metric SpacesRecommended prerequisites: MS-E1280 Measure and Integral OR MS-E1600 Probability Theory
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: MS-C1300 Complex Analysis MS-C1350 Partial Differential Equations OR MS-C1420 Fourier-analyysi MS-C1541 Metric SpacesRecommended prerequisites: MS-E1280 Measure and Integral OR MS-E1600 Probability Theory

learningOutcomes.fi:
* rigorous reasoning with Fourier series and integrals


* operating with Schwartz test functions and distributions


* recognizing applicability and connections of Fourier analysis in other parts of mathematics
learningOutcomes.sv:
* rigorous reasoning with Fourier series and integrals


* operating with Schwartz test functions and distributions


* recognizing applicability and connections of Fourier analysis in other parts of mathematics
learningOutcomes.en:
* rigorous reasoning with Fourier series and integrals


* operating with Schwartz test functions and distributions


* recognizing applicability and connections of Fourier analysis in other parts of mathematics

content.fi:
Schwartz test functions and distributions (generalized functions)


Fourier transform of integrable and square-integrable functions, measures and distributions


Summation methods for Fourier series and integrals (Fejer means)
Fourier transform in probability theory (Lévy’s inversion theorem)


Fourier analytic description of different classes of functions (Paley-Wiener theorem)


A peek into nontrigonometric Fourier analysis (such as wavelets)
 


Compared to MS-C1420 and (the Fourier analysis part of) MS-C1350, this course will both fill in several details in the development of the basic theory as well as reach out to new topics.

A peek into nontrigonometric Fourier analysis (such as wavelets)
 


Compared to MS-C1420 and (the Fourier analysis part of) MS-C1350, this course will both fill in several details in the development of the basic theory as well as reach out to new topics.

A peek into nontrigonometric Fourier analysis (such as wavelets)
 


Compared to MS-C1420 and (the Fourier analysis part of) MS-C1350, this course will both fill in several details in the development of the basic theory as well as reach out to new topics.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

workload.fi: Luennot 12 + 24 t, itsenäinen lukeminen 48 t, ryhmätyö 40 t, itsenäinen oppiminen 11 t. Yhteensä 135 t.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar 12 + 24 h, självständig läsning 48 h, grupparbete 40 h och självständig inlärning 11 h. Sammanlagt 135 h.
workload.en: Lectures 12 + 24 h, independent reading 48 h, group work 40 h, independent learning 11 h. All together 135 h.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Kurssi on vaativa, joten osallistujilta oletetaan kokemusta ja jalostunutta ajattelua.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Kursen är krävande, så av deltagarna förväntas erfarenhet och förädlat tänkande.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: The course is demanding. No special prerequisites are required except maturity of thinking and practical experience.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin jälkeen opiskelijalla on käsitys informaatiomanipulaation ja informaatiosodankäynnin pääpiirteistä sekä käytännön työstä. Lisäksi opiskelija ymmärtää miten torjua ja toimia informaatiolla manipulointia vastaan suunnittelemalla ja toteuttamalla vastakampanjoita tai -konsepteja.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen har studeranden en uppfattning om informationsmanipulation och huvudprinciperna för informationskrig samt praktiskt arbete. Därtill förstår studeranden hur man försvarar sig mot informationsmanipulation genom att planera och förverkliga motkampanjer eller motkoncept.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student has a good grasp of the main concepts, thinking, and practical work behind information manipulation and information warfare. The student also understands how to counter information manipulation activities by designing and planning counter campaigns and concepts.

content.fi: Kurssilla perehdytään informaatiovaikuttamisen pimeään puoleen, eli miten digitaalisten kanavien ja työkalujen kautta manipuloidaan ja vaikutetaan niin sodankäynnissä kuin yleisessä häiriköinnissä. Kurssin aikana on luentojen lisäksi kaksi ryhmätyötä, joista jälkimmäinen on kaksiosainen. Siinä arpomalla muodostettu ryhmä suunnittelee miten aiheuttaa yhteiskunnallista häiriötä ja kaaosta. Jälkimmäisessä osassa toinen ryhmä suunnittelee edellisen ryhmätyön konsepteille vastakonseptin.
content.sv: På kursen studeras informationspåverkans mörka sida, det vill säga hur man via digitala kanaler och verktyg manipulerar och påverkar både i krigföring och för störande av ordningen i allmänhet. I kursen ingår utöver föreläsningarna två grupparbeten, varav det senare är tvådelat. Grupperna lottas ut och varje grupp planerar hur man åstadkommer störning och kaos i samhället. I den senare delen planerar en annan grupp ett motkoncept mot det koncept som presenteras i en grupps första arbete.
content.en: During the course the students will get familiar with the "dark side" of information manipulation, especially how digital channels and tools are used to manipulate people in warfare and in societies in general. In addition to the lectures, the course has two group exercises, and the latter exercise has two parts. A group of students in the second exercise design a concept to de-stabilise a society, and after that the groups design a counter-concept to fight the de-stabilising one.

assesmentMethods.fi: Opetus koostuu vierailuluennoista, ryhmäkeskusteluista, ryhmätöistä, lukumateriaalista ja oppimispäiväkirjasta. Kurssin läpäisyyn oletetaan läsnäoloa ja aktiivista osallistumista keskusteluissa sekä ryhmätyössä. Arvosana on hyväksytty / hylätty.
assesmentMethods.sv: Undervisningen består av gästföreläsningar, gruppdiskussioner, grupparbete, läsning av litteratur och skrivande av inlärningsdagbok. För godkänd kurs krävs närvaro samt aktivt deltagande i diskussioner och grupparbeten. Vitsordsskalan är godkänd/underkänd.
assesmentMethods.en: The teaching consists of visiting lectures, group discussions, group work, reading material and a study journal. To pass the course the student is expected to actively participate in in the discussions and group work. The grade is pass/failed.

prerequisites.fi: Basic knowledge of algorithms, computational complexity, linear algebra, and discrete probability.
prerequisites.sv: Basic knowledge of algorithms, computational complexity, linear algebra, and discrete probability.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge of algorithms, computational complexity, linear algebra, and discrete probability.

learningOutcomes.fi: You know the most important data structures and algorithms used in geometric processing. You can design and analyze basic geometric algorithms. You have an understanding of computational hardness for geometric problems, and are familiar with several tools used in geometric approximation algorithms.
learningOutcomes.sv: You know the most important data structures and algorithms used in geometric processing. You can design and analyze basic geometric algorithms. You have an understanding of computational hardness for geometric problems, and are familiar with several tools used in geometric approximation algorithms.
learningOutcomes.en: You know the most important data structures and algorithms used in geometric processing. You can design and analyze basic geometric algorithms. You have an understanding of computational hardness for geometric problems, and are familiar with several tools used in geometric approximation algorithms.

content.fi: The main concepts and tools used in computational geometry: data structures, exact and approximation algorithms, computational hardness. Topics include: arrangements and duality, convex hulls, low-dimensional linear programming, orthogonal range searching, plane sweep, Voronoi diagrams and Delaunay triangulations, quadtrees, spanners, clustering, range spaces, and VC dimension.
content.sv: The main concepts and tools used in computational geometry: data structures, exact and approximation algorithms, computational hardness. Topics include: arrangements and duality, convex hulls, low-dimensional linear programming, orthogonal range searching, plane sweep, Voronoi diagrams and Delaunay triangulations, quadtrees, spanners, clustering, range spaces, and VC dimension.

workload.fi:
The study methods include:
  • Lectures
  • Independent studying
  • Mandatory assignments
  • Interviewing experts
  • Preparing and giving presentations
  • Team work
The course is intensive and cannot be passed by independent work or by just participating the contact sessions. The student is required to make necessary arrangements to be able to actively participate in contact sessions and do both independent and team assignments between the contact sessions.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: While not mandatory, taking a course related to innovation, entrepreneurship, business, product development or equivalent (e.g. NBE-E4300 Medical Device Innovation or 25C00200 Entrepreneurship and Innovation Management) is recommended before taking this course.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: While not mandatory, taking a course related to innovation, entrepreneurship, business, product development or equivalent (e.g. NBE-E4300 Medical Device Innovation or 25C00200 Entrepreneurship and Innovation Management) is recommended before taking this course.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: While not mandatory, taking a course related to innovation, entrepreneurship, business, product development or equivalent (e.g. NBE-E4300 Medical Device Innovation or 25C00200 Entrepreneurship and Innovation Management) is recommended before taking this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
During the course the student will learn how need-driven innovation and commercialization of medical technology (medtech) works. By the end of the course the student can:
1. make observations in a relevant medical environment
2. identify problems from the observations
3. derive needs from problems
4. develop solution concept to address the need
5. develop a business concept for the solution
6. communicate the business concept to investors
 
The skills learned will be applicable for innovating any new concepts, conducting medtech R&D, developing research questions, or taking your first steps towards your own medtech startup.

During the course the student will learn how need-driven innovation and commercialization of medical technology (medtech) works. By the end of the course the student can:
1. make observations in a relevant medical environment
2. identify problems from the observations
3. derive needs from problems
4. develop solution concept to address the need
5. develop a business concept for the solution
6. communicate the business concept to investors
 
The skills learned will be applicable for innovating any new concepts, conducting medtech R&D, developing research questions, or taking your first steps towards your own medtech startup.

content.fi: The contents of the course include e.g., needs identification, concept creation, customer-centric design, business model basic, and regulatory process of medical technology. Sustainability aspects in developing a medtech solution are also considered.  During the course, together with your multidisciplinary team, you will create a concept and a business case for your own medical technology. Your solution addresses a real and validated need in healthcare, based on direct observations of problems. By the end of the course, you will pitch your concept and medtech business case to real investors in a "Biodesign Dolphin Tank".

Your solution addresses a real and validated need in healthcare, based on direct observations of problems. By the end of the course, you will pitch your concept and medtech business case to real investors in a "Biodesign Dolphin Tank".

Your solution addresses a real and validated need in healthcare, based on direct observations of problems. By the end of the course, you will pitch your concept and medtech business case to real investors in a "Biodesign Dolphin Tank".

assesmentMethods.fi: Passing assignments on the first week of the course is required. Further, the student has to demonstrate a significant contribution in (i) the development of the team's business concept, (ii) daily assignments between contact session and (iii) preparation of the pitch presentation, along the intended learning goals. The student demonstrates ability to critically consider sustainability aspects in the development of a medtech business concept.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Matrices and linear algebra (MS-A001, recommended MS-C1342, or equivalent knowledge). Basic skills in signal analysis / frequency representation (for example ELEC-A7200 or MS-C1420, or skills obtained in practice) Basic skills in Python or MATLAB.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Matrices and linear algebra (MS-A001, recommended MS-C1342, or equivalent knowledge). Basic skills in signal analysis / frequency representation (for example ELEC-A7200 or MS-C1420, or skills obtained in practice) Basic skills in Python or MATLAB.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Matrices and linear algebra (MS-A001, recommended MS-C1342, or equivalent knowledge). Basic skills in signal analysis / frequency representation (for example ELEC-A7200 or MS-C1420, or skills obtained in practice) Basic skills in Python or MATLAB.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course:
  1. The student understands the basic linear techniques for biomedical signal processing from a fundamental and intuitive geometrical perspective.
  2. The student can give a basic description of commonly used non-linear techniques and knows when to prefer them to linear techniques.
  3. Given a scientific question and biomedical measurement, the student can select and apply suitable techniques and contribute to data analysis at various stages.
  4. The student recognizes the risk of overinterpreting the results of an analysis.

content.fi: This course covers some of the essential notions needed to analyse biomedical data, including basic statistical concepts, spectral methods, linear methods and non-linear methods for analyzing time-series and other multi-dimensional data.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-C2128 Ennustaminen ja aikasarja-analyysi, MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX, MS-A05XX
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-C2128 Prediktering och tidsserieanalys, MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX, MS-A05XX

learningOutcomes.fi:
Opintojakson suoritettuaan opiskelija 
1. osaa hyödyntää systeemiajattelua, systeemidynamiikkaa ja pelejä laajojen dynaamisten systeemien identifioinnissa ja ohjaamisessa, 
2. osaa rakentaa aikasarja-malleja ja toteuttaa aikasarja-analyyseja.
learningOutcomes.sv: Bli bekant med problemlösning i operationsgranskning.
learningOutcomes.en: Get familiar with problem solving in operations research.

content.fi: Kaksi harjoitustyötä matemaattisten mallien käytännön toteutuksesta ja analyysistä; systeemiajattelun, systeemidynamiikan ja pelien hyödyntäminen laajojen dynaamisten systeemien identifioinnissa ja ohjaamisessa; aikasarja-mallien rakentaminen ja aikasarja-analyysien toteuttaminen.
content.sv: Två tämligen stora övningsarbete inom implementering och analys av matematiska modeller. Övningsarbeten behandlar systemdynamik och prediktering med hjälp av tidsserieanalys.
content.en: Two fairly large assignments on the implementation and analysis of mathematical models. The assignments deal with system dynamics and time-series analysis.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tavoitteena on luoda kestävää arvoa laatimalla itse määritettyyn tarpeeseen liittyvä, kokeiluille perustuva ja kumppanille soveltuva etenemissuunnitelma uuden tai nykyisen tuotteen kehittämiseksi. Soveltuvissa tapauksissa tämä saattaa myös projektin aikana tarkentua muihin tuotteeseen liittyviin kokeiluihin ja kehittämiseen.   Projektin pohjana on itse tunnistettu käyttäjien ja asiakkaiden tarve. Tämä tarve valitaan lähtökohtaisesti siten, että projektissa on mahdollista luoda sekä kestävää yhteiskunnallista että liiketoiminnallista arvoa kehittämällä yrityksen tai organisaation tuotetta tai tarjoamaa. Projektia ohjaa aiheen vaatima tarkoituksenmukaisuus ja toteutettavuus, joten lopulliset tulokset riippuvat kustakin aiheesta, kumppanista ja projektista. Kurssin suoritettuaan, opiskelijalla on käsitys yrittäjyyden ensimmäisistä vaiheista sekä tuotejohtamisen perusteista. Opiskelija osaa
  • tunnistaa yrittäjyys- ja kehitysprojektien tyypillisiä alkuvaiheita
  • kehittää ja perustella tunnistetun tarpeen merkitystä ja arvoa käyttäjän, liiketoiminnan sekä yhteiskunnan näkökulmista
  • tunnistaa organisaatioiden kehitystoimintojen pääpiirteitä ja työskennellä kehittävällä ja mahdollisuuksia kehkeyttävällä tavalla kumppaneiden ja muiden sidosryhmien kanssa
  • hyödyntää yhtä tai useampaa tutkimusmenetelmää käyttäjän ja/tai asiakkaan tarpeiden kartoittamiseksi sekä kehitettävän ratkaisun validoinniksi
  • tunnistaa yritysten liiketoimintamallien keskeisimpiä piirteitä, ja vertailla ja analysoida eri yritysten sekä nykyisiä että mahdollisia liiketoimintamalleja
  • luoda perusteltu, koeteltu, ja kumppanille soveltuva suunnitelma tuotteen kehittämiseksi 
  • tunnistaa ja eritellä omaa toimintaansa ja reaktioitaan avoimessa ja määrittelemättömässä ongelmanratkaisuprosessissa
  • suunnata ja kehittää projektiryhmän työskentelyä keskusteluiden ja fasilitoivien työkalujen avulla
learningOutcomes.sv:
Målet med kursen är att utforma ett genomförbart experiment on produktledning som hjälper en partnerorganisation att utveckla antingen sitt erbjudande eller förmågan att utforska dessa möjligheter senare. Projektet bygger på ett av studenten identifierat ämne och till detta relaterat användar- och kundbehov, som fungerar som grund för hållbart värdeskapande för samhället och näringslivet. Projektet styrs av ämnets relevans och genomförbarhet, så de slutliga resultaten kommer att bero på varje ämne, partner och projekt. Efter avslutad kurs har studenten en uppfattning om de första etapperna av entreprenörskap och om pricipen i produktledning. Studenten kan
  • identifiera typiska faser och element i entreprenörskaps- och utvecklingsprojekt och analysera dem med hjälp av en resursorienterad utvecklingsprocess (effektuation)
  • utveckla och motivera lösningens betydelse och värde ur både socialt och affärsmässigt perspektiv
  • identifiera nyckelelementen och egenskaperna i affärs- och organisationsutveckling, och kan arbeta med partners och intressenter för att skapa och utveckla möjligheter
  • använda en eller flera forskningsmetoder för att kartlägga användarens och/eller kundens behov
  • identifiera viktiga funktioner i affärsmodeller och jämföra och analysera olika företags affärsmodeller, både befintliga och potentiella
  • identifiera och analysera sina egna handlingar och reaktioner i en öppen och ospecificerad problemlösningsprocess
  • kan styra och utveckla arbetsmetoderna för en projektgrupp med diskussions- och faciliterings verktyg
learningOutcomes.en:
The goal of the course is to design an implementable business experiment in product management that helps a partner organization to develop either its offering or the capabilities towards exploring these opportunities later. The project is based on a self-identified topic and a related customer and user need that serves as a basis for sustainable value creation for society and business. The final outcomes of the project depend on what the topic, needs, and the related opportunities. After the course, the students will understand the early stages of the entrepreneurial process and principles of product management. More specifically, the student:
  • Recognizes the phases and elements of the entrepreneurial process of identifying and developing opportunities, and can relate these to the elements of effectuation theory
  • Develop and justify the value and purposefulness of a solution from the perspectives of business and society
  • Recognizes the key elements and characteristics of business and organization development, and can work with partners and stakeholders in order to create and develop opportunities
  • Is able to apply research methods to acquire data on customer preferences and interpret the results
  • Recognizes the elements of a business model, is able to use business model tools to analyze existing businesses, and has preliminary skills to analytically compare businesses and identify the crucial aspects of the (business?) development process.
  • Recognizes his/her own reactions to an ambiguous search process
  • Can direct and develop the working methods of a project group with discussion and facilitation tools

content.fi: Kurssi muodostuu ryhmässä tehtävästä, itseohjautuvasta projektista, jossa on kaksi keskeistä vaihetta. Ensimmäisessä vaiheessa identifioidaan kiinnostava ja lupaava aihe ja selvitetään konkreettisia ja merkityksellisiä tarpeita siihen liittyen. Näiden pohjalta etsitään yksi tai useampi kumppani ja määritetään yhteinen projekti. Toisessa vaiheessa kumppanin kanssa kehitetään mahdollisia keinoja vastata tarkennettuihin tarpeisiin, ja muotoillaan tulokset toteuttamiskelpoiseksi kokeiluksi. Projektin rinnalla kurssin yhteis- ja ohjaustapaamisissa suunnataan ja kirkastetaan projektin etenemistä.
content.sv: Kursen består av ett självstyrt grupp-projekt med två viktiga faser. Det första steget är att identifiera ett intressant och lovande ämne och sedan identifiera de konkreta och relevanta behoven för det. Baserat på detta arbete väljs en eller flera partners varefter ett gemensamt projekt kan definieras. Den andra fasen består av utvecklingsarbete med partnern, då utforskas nya möjligheter att möta de identifierade behoven. Resultaten kommer att utformas till ett genomförbart experiment. Projektet stöds av coaching, reflektion och handledningsmöten.
content.en: The course consists of a self-directed group project that consists of  two parts. The first part is based on an entrepreneurial search process, where you will independently and proactively search for an initial definition of a user need, and then explore opportunities to partner with an appropriate and willing organization. The second part is based on working with the partner(s) to explore how it could explore a new opportunity to renew its offering.The project is supported by coaching, reflection and presentation meetings.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Student knows how to identify operational constraints in current operations and services and to design solutions using emerging technologies to address those constraints.
Student can identify the limitations of state of the art operations management practices and critically evaluate improvement proposals.
Students understand design thinking and are able to apply innovation management concepts and frameworks for innovative operations management.
learningOutcomes.sv: Student knows how to identify operational constraints in current operations and services and to design solutions using emerging technologies to address those constraints.Student can identify the limitations of state of the art operations management practices and critically evaluate improvement proposals.Students understand design thinking and are able to apply innovation management concepts and frameworks for innovative operations management.
learningOutcomes.en: Student knows how to identify operational constraints in current operations and services and to design solutions using emerging technologies to address those constraints.Student can identify the limitations of state of the art operations management practices and critically evaluate improvement proposals.Students understand design thinking and are able to apply innovation management concepts and frameworks for innovative operations management.

content.fi: The course is built around a number of real-life innovative solutions in operations and services. These solutions are presented by invited guest lecturers from industry and research groups. The students are this way - in class - taken to the cutting-edge of practice by the guest lecturer and challenged to address a current innovation problem. In doing so, the students will propose a real-life innovative solution.Students will in groups work on one specific innovation problem, and evaluate solution proposals to all others presented in the course. Both solution and evaluation activities are conducted in a group. In class, innovation management theory is introduced and discussed in the context of the innovation problems and solution proposals.An individual concluding assignment allow students to synthesize and reflect on the full course work.

learningOutcomes.fi: In this course, students will get familiar with combinatorics through selected exciting ideas in theoretical computer science (in particular, algorithms and complexity). You will obtain a basic understanding of various types of combinatorial objects and their relationships. Upon completing the course you are able to apply basic combinatorial analysis and proof techniques.
learningOutcomes.sv: In this course, students will get familiar with combinatorics through selected exciting ideas in theoretical computer science (in particular, algorithms and complexity). You will obtain a basic understanding of various types of combinatorial objects and their relationships. Upon completing the course you are able to apply basic combinatorial analysis and proof techniques.
learningOutcomes.en: In this course, students will get familiar with combinatorics through selected exciting ideas in theoretical computer science (in particular, algorithms and complexity). You will obtain a basic understanding of various types of combinatorial objects and their relationships. Upon completing the course you are able to apply basic combinatorial analysis and proof techniques.

content.fi: • Part I: Extremal combinatorics & computation: We cover extremal combinatorics (e.g., Ramsey's theory) through the lens of graph algorithms and data structures.• Part II: Probability & computation: We introduce probabilistic combinatorics through the lens of algorithms. We show applications such as streaming algorithms and graph sparsification. You will also see the boundaries between constructive and nonconstruc tive methods in combinatorics, which highlight the transfer of techniques between combinatorics and computation

You will also see the boundaries between constructive and nonconstruc tive methods in combinatorics, which highlight the transfer of techniques between combinatorics and computation

prerequisites.fi:
This course requires background and knowledge about cloud computing, distributed computing, operating systems, and basic databases.   For students to fulfil such background and knowledge, students must either (1) finish the follow courses in Aalto: CS-C3140 Operating Systems and CS-E4190 Cloud Software and Systems, or (2) demonstrate that students understand relevant concepts and technologies like  distributed computing infrastructures, service discovery, virtualization and containers, distributed filesystems and  databases. Furthermore, students must be able to program well with one or two common programming languages, such as Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, GoLang, Python, and Scala.
Prerequisites will be checked through students's completed courses and/or through pre-assignment/interview with responsible teachers.
It is an advantage for the study if students have finished courses covering topics in Parallel Computing, NoSQL databases, Service Design as well as to be able to work with more than the above-mentioned programming languages as well as to be familar with working in large-scale computing enviromments.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course, the student is able to
  • understand big data and platforms w.r.t. services, stakeholders, interactions and state-of-the-art technologies
  • understand key interactions and performance design patterns in big data platforms
  • produce designs of big data platforms with key services like data stores, data ingestion, batch and stream processing
  • demonstrate design and implementation of big data ingestion, batch processing, streaming processing and data governance processes.
  • assess performance and reliability issues in operating big data platforms
  • deliver real-world prototypes of big data platforms with real datasets and technologies in a large-scale systems.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After this course, the student is able to
  • understand big data and platforms w.r.t. services, stakeholders, interactions and state-of-the-art technologies
  • understand key interactions and performance design patterns in big data platforms
  • produce designs of big data platforms with key services like data stores, data ingestion, batch and stream processing
  • demonstrate design and implementation of big data ingestion, batch processing, streaming processing and data governance processes.
  • assess performance and reliability issues in operating big data platforms
  • deliver real-world prototypes of big data platforms with real datasets and technologies in a large-scale systems.
learningOutcomes.en:
After this course, the student is able to
  • understand big data and platforms w.r.t. services, stakeholders, interactions and state-of-the-art technologies
  • understand key interactions and performance design patterns in big data platforms
  • produce designs of big data platforms with key services like data stores, data ingestion, batch and stream processing
  • demonstrate design and implementation of big data ingestion, batch processing, streaming processing and data governance processes.
  • assess performance and reliability issues in operating big data platforms
  • deliver real-world prototypes of big data platforms with real datasets and technologies in a large-scale systems.

content.fi: The course will provide  knowledge covering main aspects of big data platforms, including data platform services and ecosystems,  architectures and designs for big data, core services in big data stores, big data ingestion techniques, big data processing models (batch and streaming), and big data governance. Common aspects like users, developers and providers interactions, reliability, performance and elasticity for big data plaforms will be studied and implemented. Both design, development and operations of big data platforms are covered.
content.sv: The course will provide  knowledge covering main aspects of big data platforms, including data platform services and ecosystems,  architectures and designs for big data, core services in big data stores, big data ingestion techniques, big data processing models (batch and streaming), and big data governance. Common aspects like users, developers and providers interactions, reliability, performance and elasticity for big data plaforms will be studied and implemented. Both design, development and operations of big data platforms are covered.
content.en: The course will provide  knowledge covering main aspects of big data platforms, including data platform services and ecosystems,  architectures and designs for big data, core services in big data stores, big data ingestion techniques, big data processing models (batch and streaming), and big data governance. Common aspects like users, developers and providers interactions, reliability, performance and elasticity for big data plaforms will be studied and implemented. Both design, development and operations of big data platforms are covered.

assesmentMethods.fi: Assigments and exams (based on Q/A for assignments). Each assignment will include theoretical concepts, big datasets, component designs, software implementation and testing, and extensibility/integration discussions.
assesmentMethods.sv: Assigments and exams (based on Q/A for assignments). Each assignment will include theoretical concepts, big datasets, component designs, software implementation and testing, and extensibility/integration discussions.
assesmentMethods.en: Assigments and exams (based on Q/A for assignments). Each assignment will include theoretical concepts, big datasets, component designs, software implementation and testing, and extensibility/integration discussions.

additionalInformation.fi: Teaching Language : English Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Spring III - IV 2023-2024 Spring III - IV Enrollment : Registration for Courses: Registration will be manually approved, based on the prerequisites that the students provide. Students who are not able to present the required completed courses for prerequisites must be interviewed or must perform pre-assignments for considering to be in the course. Maximum number of registered students for credits will be limited to 80. The course allows students who want to audit the course. However, since the course aims at making real-world prototypes in big data platforms, such students should not register the course for credits. Instead, the student just follow lectures and tutorials without registration.

prerequisites.fi: Basics in mathematics, statistics, computer science and programming.
prerequisites.sv: Basics in mathematics, statistics, computer science and programming.
prerequisites.en: Basics in mathematics, statistics, computer science and programming.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.
learningOutcomes.en: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.

content.fi: The course introduces computational and statistical methods for analyzing modern high-throughput biological data and their use in systems biology. The course covers microarray, high-throughput sequencing (HTS), single-cell and mass-spectrometry technologies and computational methods for HTS data alignment, genotyping, gene expression analysis, chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing, epigenetics and proteomics. Relevant high-throughput measurement technologies are reviewed during the course.
content.sv: The course introduces computational and statistical methods for analyzing modern high-throughput biological data and their use in systems biology. The course covers microarray, high-throughput sequencing (HTS), single-cell and mass-spectrometry technologies and computational methods for HTS data alignment, genotyping, gene expression analysis, chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing, epigenetics and proteomics. Relevant high-throughput measurement technologies are reviewed during the course.
content.en: The course introduces computational and statistical methods for analyzing modern high-throughput biological data and their use in systems biology. The course covers microarray, high-throughput sequencing (HTS), single-cell and mass-spectrometry technologies and computational methods for HTS data alignment, genotyping, gene expression analysis, chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing, epigenetics and proteomics. Relevant high-throughput measurement technologies are reviewed during the course.

organizationName.en: Department of Computer Science

workload.fi: 5 op (133 h) lähiopetus ryhmätapaamisissa ja tapaamisiin valmistautuminen sekä demonstraatiot, kirjalliset ja ohjelmointiharjoitustehtävät, projektityö ryhmässä, kurssipalaute.
workload.sv: 5 sp (133 h) närundervisning gruppmöten och förberedandet för dessa möten och demonstrationer, programmerings- och skriftliga uppgifter, projects med grupp, feedback på kursen.
workload.en: 5 cr (133 h) group meetings and preparation for the meetings, written and programming exercises, group projects, work in a group, course feedback.

prerequisites.fi: Kurssi on tarkoitettu suoritettavaksi samanaikaisesti kurssin CS-A1110 Ohjelmointi 1 kanssa. Vain Teknistieteellisen kandidaattiohjelman tietotekniikan ja informaatioverkostojen pääaineiden opiskelijoille.
prerequisites.sv: Kursen är tänkt att tas samtidigt med CS-A1110 Programmering 1. Enbart för studerande vid kandidatprogram i teknikvetenskap som har datateknik eller informationsnätverk som sitt huvudämne.
prerequisites.en: The course is intended to be taken simultaneously with CS-A1110 Programming 1. Only for the students of the Bachelor's programme in Science and Technology who have Computer Science and Engineering or Information Networks as their major.

learningOutcomes.fi: Osaat suunnitella pieniä ohjelmia ja arvioida ohjelmien suunnitelmia ja toteutuksia eri kriteerein. Osaat tehdä ohjelmointityötä ryhmässä ja olet tutustunut ryhmätyöskentelyssä tarvittaviin käytänteisiin ja työkaluihin kuten versionhallintaan. Olet tutustunut yksikkötestaukseen ja ohjelmoinnin työkaluihin.
learningOutcomes.sv: Du kan utforma små program och utvärdera design och implementering av program med olika kriterier. Du vet hur man gör programmering i en grupp och känner till de verktyg och praxis som krävs för grupparbete, t.ex. versionskontroll. Du är bekant med enhetstestning och programmeringsverktyg.
learningOutcomes.en: You are able to design small programs and evaluate the design and implementation of programs with different criteria. You know how to do programming in a group and are familiar with the tools and practices needed for group work such as version control. You are familiar with unit testing and programming tools.

content.fi: Opiskelijat oppivat ratkaisemaan annettuja ongelmia olio-ohjelmoinnin keinoin.
content.sv: Studenterna lär sig lösa givna problem genom att använda objekt-orienterad programmering.
content.en: The students learn to solve the given problems using object-oriented programming.

assesmentMethods.fi: Ryhmätapaamiset, kirjalliset tehtävät, ohjelmointiharjoitukset ja pienehköt projektityöt.
assesmentMethods.sv: Gruppmöten, skriftliga uppgifter, programmeringsövningar och små projecter.
assesmentMethods.en: Group meetings, written exercises, programming exercises and small projects.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli : suomi Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Syksy I - II  2023-2024 Syksy I - II Ilmoittautuminen : 2-3 luentoryhmää. Opiskelijat sijoitetaan yhteen luentoryhmään.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket : finska Undervisningsperiod : 2022-2023 Höst I - II  2023-2024 Höst I - II Anmälning : 2-3 föreläsninsgrupper. Studenterna placeras i en föreläsningsgrupp.
additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language : Finnish Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Autumn I - II  2023-2024 Autumn I - II Enrollment : 2-3 Lecture groups. Student is placed in one.

workload.fi: The course consits of lectures, exercises and assignments, projects, and exam. Details will be specified at the course webpage at the beginning of the course.
workload.sv: The course consits of lectures, exercises and assignments, projects, and exam. Details will be specified at the course webpage at the beginning of the course.
workload.en: The course consits of lectures, exercises and assignments, projects, and exam. Details will be specified at the course webpage at the beginning of the course.

prerequisites.fi: Basic bioinformatics, mathematics, statistics/probabilistic modeling, machine learning and programming courses, or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: Basic bioinformatics, mathematics, statistics/probabilistic modeling, machine learning and programming courses, or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.en: Basic bioinformatics, mathematics, statistics/probabilistic modeling, machine learning and programming courses, or equivalent knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.

content.fi: Mathematical and statistical models of biological molecular-level networks, such as gene regulation, epigenetics, signaling, and metabolism. Models covered in the course include stochastic chemical reaction networks, ordinary differential equations, Bayesian and dependency networks, regression models and random networks. Statistical methods for inference of networks from data, and prediction using the models. Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.
content.sv: Mathematical and statistical models of biological molecular-level networks, such as gene regulation, epigenetics, signaling, and metabolism. Models covered in the course include stochastic chemical reaction networks, ordinary differential equations, Bayesian and dependency networks, regression models and random networks. Statistical methods for inference of networks from data, and prediction using the models. Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.

Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.

prerequisites.en: Basic bioinformatics, mathematics, statistics/probabilistic modeling, machine learning and programming courses, or equivalent knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course students will have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental methodological concepts underlying modeling of biological networks and systems. Students will learn to choose appropriate modeling methods for a variety of small- and large-scale problems as well as for different types of experimental data. Students will learn to apply various computational and statistical modeling methods in real interdisciplinary biological problems and have sufficient knowledge to explore the topic further.

content.fi: Mathematical and statistical models of biological molecular-level networks, such as gene regulation, epigenetics, signaling, and metabolism. Models covered in the course include stochastic chemical reaction networks, ordinary differential equations, Bayesian and dependency networks, regression models and random networks. Statistical methods for inference of networks from data, and prediction using the models. Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.
content.sv: Mathematical and statistical models of biological molecular-level networks, such as gene regulation, epigenetics, signaling, and metabolism. Models covered in the course include stochastic chemical reaction networks, ordinary differential equations, Bayesian and dependency networks, regression models and random networks. Statistical methods for inference of networks from data, and prediction using the models. Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.
content.en: Mathematical and statistical models of biological molecular-level networks, such as gene regulation, epigenetics, signaling, and metabolism. Models covered in the course include stochastic chemical reaction networks, ordinary differential equations, Bayesian and dependency networks, regression models and random networks. Statistical methods for inference of networks from data, and prediction using the models. Mainly probabilistic and machine learning models.

workload.fi:
Lectures 6x1.5 h, computer exercises appr. 7x1.5 h, independent studying (lectures, programming, exercise reports), final exam.
Work load: Contact teaching 20 h + independent work studying for and completing the exercises 80 h + independent work doing the peer reviewing 10 h + preparing for and taking the exam 25 h = 135 h (5 cr).

prerequisites.fi: The student should have basic programming skills. The programming language Python will be used. First year mathematics.
prerequisites.sv: The student should have basic programming skills. The programming language Python will be used. First year mathematics.
prerequisites.en: The student should have basic programming skills. The programming language Python will be used. First year mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course you have a good command of selected central concepts and tools in stochastics.
You can program and use algorithms for analysing data and simulating and solving problems related to stochastic processes.
You have a thorough understanding of Monte Carlo-based methods and some of its advanced variants and a fair background for studying Bayesian statistical modelling.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course you have a good command of selected central concepts and tools in stochastics.
You can program and use algorithms for analysing data and simulating and solving problems related to stochastic processes.
You have a thorough understanding of Monte Carlo-based methods and some of its advanced variants and a fair background for studying Bayesian statistical modelling.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course you have a good command of selected central concepts and tools in stochastics.
You can program and use algorithms for analysing data and simulating and solving problems related to stochastic processes.
You have a thorough understanding of Monte Carlo-based methods and some of its advanced variants and a fair background for studying Bayesian statistical modelling.

content.fi:
Fundamentals of relevant numerical mathematics, practical tools for data analysis (such as logarithmic binning), generation of random variables from different distributions,
Markov chains, Monte Carlo methods (MCMC, Hamiltonian MC), some of the most important stochastic processes (e.g. Poisson, Gaussian, First-Passage)

Markov chains, Monte Carlo methods (MCMC, Hamiltonian MC), some of the most important stochastic processes (e.g. Poisson, Gaussian, First-Passage)

assesmentMethods.fi: The final grade is determined by the following weighted sum:  Computational assignments (70 %) + examination (30 %). Within computational assignments grading consists of the completed assignments (80 %) + peer reviewing (20 %). If this needs to be modified, it will be agreed upon at the start of the course.

prerequisites.fi: CS-A1111/1113 Basic Course in Programming Y1.
prerequisites.sv: CS-A1111/1113 Basic Course in Programming Y1.
prerequisites.en: CS-A1111/1113 Basic Course in Programming Y1.

learningOutcomes.fi: After taking the course you can design and implement an object-oriented program consisting of several classes. You are able to use object-oriented abstractions such as inheritance. You understand the effects of design decisions on the functionality of program and on the program development process, especially on the further development of the code. You can justify and document the key design decisions made during the process. You know how to use unit testing in program development. You can use tools in an integrated development environment. You know the basics of concurrent programming and how they can be applied in a simple case. You can find information from documentation of programming language and libraries, and from net.
learningOutcomes.sv: After taking the course you can design and implement an object-oriented program consisting of several classes. You are able to use object-oriented abstractions such as inheritance. You understand the effects of design decisions on the functionality of program and on the program development process, especially on the further development of the code. You can justify and document the key design decisions made during the process. You know how to use unit testing in program development. You can use tools in an integrated development environment. You know the basics of concurrent programming and how they can be applied in a simple case. You can find information from documentation of programming language and libraries, and from net.

You understand the effects of design decisions on the functionality of program and on the program development process, especially on the further development of the code. You can justify and document the key design decisions made during the process. You know how to use unit testing in program development. You can use tools in an integrated development environment. You know the basics of concurrent programming and how they can be applied in a simple case. You can find information from documentation of programming language and libraries, and from net.

content.fi: Basics of object-oriented program design, techniques and methodology; programming tools. More advanced programming abstractions. The personal course project includes planning, programming, testing, and documenting activities.

prerequisites.fi: SCI-C1001 SCI project or MUO-C3006 Palvelumuotoilun perusteet or similar basic course on design and project work is required. CS-C1180 Verkkojulkaisemisen perusteet or similar basics of web and media design is recommended. TU-E6150 Technology & society or CS-E5610 Social Media or similar basics of technology and society, and or sustainable development is recommended.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course you have a real life hands-on experience on how societal problems are worked into strategic design problems and tackled with design, agile, and lean startup methods. You learn to combine many of your previous studies into a realistic project setting: group work, facilitation, societal understanding, data analytics, software design, service design methods, business and strategy thinking, and creating an actionable solution towards a social problem. Also, you learn how to turn concrete project work into personal development and learning to help you become an even better professional.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course you have a real life hands-on experience on how societal problems are worked into strategic design problems and tackled with design, agile, and lean startup methods. You learn to combine many of your previous studies into a realistic project setting: group work, facilitation, societal understanding, data analytics, software design, service design methods, business and strategy thinking, and creating an actionable solution towards a social problem. Also, you learn how to turn concrete project work into personal development and learning to help you become an even better professional.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course you have a real life hands-on experience on how societal problems are worked into strategic design problems and tackled with design, agile, and lean startup methods. You learn to combine many of your previous studies into a realistic project setting: group work, facilitation, societal understanding, data analytics, software design, service design methods, business and strategy thinking, and creating an actionable solution towards a social problem. Also, you learn how to turn concrete project work into personal development and learning to help you become an even better professional.

content.fi: In the course the students work in a group on a real societal problem together with a real organisation looking into solving that problem. The course is divided into three parts. First is the preparation phase where the project context and metrics for success are defined, as well as the personal learning goals for each student. The second part of the course is an intensive design project in the end of which the team presents a service concept. The third part of the course is about reflecting and learning from the intense and realistic project setting.

organizationName.en: Department of Computer Science

workload.fi: Luennot ja työpajat noin 35–40 h, itsenäinen ryhmätyö noin 95–100 h.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar och workshop ca 35–40 timmar, grupparbete ca 95–100 timmar.
workload.en: Lectures and workshops approximately 35–40 h, group assignment approximately 95–100 h.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tavoitteena on kehittää opiskelijan ymmärrystä tarve- ja käyttäjälähtöisestä kehittämisestä ja kykyä soveltaa sitä avoimien tuote- ja palvelukehityshaasteiden ratkaisemiseen. Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
  • tuntee käyttäjälähtöisen tuote- ja palvelusuunnittelun keskeiset käsitteet ja toimintatavat sekä osaa soveltaa niitä käytäntöön
  • osaa kerätä ja koostaa tietoa ongelmakentästä käyttäjien ja muiden sidosryhmien näkökulmista sekä hyödyntää keräämäänsä tietoa kehitystyössään
  • osaa arvioida ja testata ratkaisujen toimivuutta sekä käyttäjän tarpeiden että toteutettavuuden kannalta prototyyppien avulla
  • osaa viestiä tuote- ja palvelukehitysprojektin etenemisestä ja tuloksista
  • löytää oman roolinsa tiimityössä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kursens syfte är att utveckla studentens förståelse för behovs- och användarinriktad utveckling och förmåga att tillämpa detta för att lösa öppna utmaningar inom produkt- och serviceutveckling. Efter kursen:
  • känner studenten till de centrala begreppen och mekanismerna inom användarinriktad produkt- och tjänstedesign och kan tillämpa dem i praktiken
  • kan studenten samla och sammanställa information angående problemfältet ur användarens och övriga intressegruppers synvinkel samt nyttja informationen i sitt utvecklingsarbete
  • kan studenten utvärdera och testa lösningens funktionalitet med hjälp av prototyper, utgående både från användarens behov samt genomförbarheten.
  • kan studenten kommunicera framsteg och resultat i produkt- och serviceutvecklingsprojektet
  • hittar sin egen roll i grupparbete
learningOutcomes.en:
The goal of the course is to develop skills in user-centric development and ability to apply these skills in product and service development. After the course, the student
  • is familiar with key concepts and practices of product and service development and is able to apply them in practice
  • can collect and synthesize knowledge from users and other stakeholders and utilize this knowledge in product and service development
  • can evaluate and test the appropriateness of solutions in terms of needs and feasibility using prototypes
  • can communicate the progressions and results of a development project
  • finds his/her role in teamwork

content.fi: Kurssin sisältö noudattaa käyttäjäkeskeisen suunnittelun vaiheita. Kurssilla työskennellään menetelmin, jotka vahvistavat opiskelijoiden valmiuksia ratkoa monitahoisia ongelmia, toimia monialaisessa asiantuntijaryhmässä sekä soveltaa iteratiivisia suunnittelukäytäntöjä.
content.sv: Kursens innehåll följer olika skeden inom användarcentrerad design. Kursens arbetsmetoder är att förstärka studerandens förmåga att lösa mångsidiga problem, arbeta i ett multidisciplinärt team samt tillämpa iterativa designprocesser.
content.en: The course follows the phases of user centric design process. The working methods in the course strengthens the students ability to address complex problems, work in a multidisciplinary team, and apply iterative design practices.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssi suoritetaan projektimuotoisena tiimityönä. Tiimit määrittelevät ja rajaavat ongelman käsiteltävästä teema-alueesta, etsivät siihen ratkaisuvaihtoehtoja ja analysoivat niitä. Tiimit testaavat ideoitaan prototyyppien avulla ja kehittävät niitä kerätyn palautteen perusteella. Kurssi arvostellaan osasuoritusten perusteella. Arvosana määrittyy tiimikohtaisena. Tarvittaessa yksittäisen tiiminjäsenen arvosana voi perustellusta syystä poiketa tiimikohtaisesta arvosanasta. Tarkemmat arvosteluperiaatteet julkaistaan kurssin MyCourses-sivuilla.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursen genomförs som ett projektbaserat grupparbete. Grupperna skall definiera och begränsa problemet inom ett visst temaområde, hitta alternativa lösningar samt analysera och testa dem. Gruppen skall testa sina idéer med hjälp av prototyper och utveckla dem på basis av insamlad feedback. I bedömningen av kursen beaktas de olika delprestationerna. Kursen bedöms med ett vitsord för hela gruppen. På grund av välmotiverade skäl kan en enskild gruppmedlems vitsord avvika från hela gruppens vitsord. Närmare information om kursbedömning och utvärdering publiceras på kursen MyCycourses sidor.
assesmentMethods.en: The course consists of project work done in teams. The teams define the focus and scope of the problem within a given theme, develop solutions, and analyze them. The teams test their ideas with prototypes and develop the solutions further based on the feedback. Grading is done on the level of teams, but for justified reasons the grade of an individual member may differ from the team-based grade. More specific grading criteria are published in MyCourses pages.

organizationName.en: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management

prerequisites.fi: lukion matematiikka.
prerequisites.sv: gymnasiet matematik.
prerequisites.en: high school mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa analysoida jonojen ja sarjojen suppenemista
- tuntee alkeisfunktioiden sarjakehitelmät ja approksimaatiot
- hallitsee tärkeimmät derivaatan ja integraalin ominaisuudet, laskumenetelmät ja sovellukset
- osaa ratkaista 1. kertaluvun lineaarisen ja separoituvan differentiaaliyhtälön
- osaa ratkaista 2. kertaluvun lineaarisen differentiaaliyhtälön vakiokertoimisessa tapauksessa
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna analysera konvergens av talföljder och serier - känna till serieutvecklingar och approximationer av elementära funktioner - behärsk de viktigaste egenskaperna, räknemetoderna och tillämpningarna av derivatan och integralen - kunna lösa en separerbar differentialekvation av första ordningen - kunna lösa en linjär differentialekvation av andra ordningen med konstanta koefficienter
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will - be able to analyze the convergence of sequences and series - be familiar with the series expansions and approximations of elementary functions - master the most important properties, calculation methods, and applications of the derivative and the integral - be able to solve a first order differential equation in the linear and separable cases - be able to solve a linear second order differential equation in the case of constant coefficients

content.fi: jonot, sarjat, potenssisarjat, derivaatta ja integraali, tavallisten differentiaaliyhtälöiden perustyyppien ratkaisumenetelmät
content.sv: följder, serier, potensserier, derivata och integral, metoder för att lösa vissa enkla differentialekvationer
content.en: sequences, series, power series, derivatives and integrals, basic types of differential equations

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1110, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
substitutes.sv:
Tillsammans med kursen MS-A00XX Matrisräkning ersätter kurser Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1110, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710.
Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
substitutes.en: Together with the course MS-A00XX Matrix algebra substitutes the courses Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1110, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710. Substitutes the courses MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1.

teachingPeriod.en: i : suomi
teachingPeriod.sv: i : suomi

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

prerequisites.fi: MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta, MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A00XX Matrisräkning, MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea approksimaatioita osittaisderivaattojen avulla
- osaa ratkaista yhtälöryhmiä Newtonin menetelmällä
- tuntee ja ymmärtää optimoinnin perusideoita
- osaa käyttää Lagrangen kertoimia
- osaa laskea taso- ja avaruusintegraaleja
- osaa vaihtaa integroimisjärjestyksen tasointegraalissa
- osaa vaihtaa muuttujia taso- ja avaruusintegraalissa
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna räkna approximationer med hjälp av partiella derivator - kunna lösa ekvationssystem med Newtons metod - känna till och förstår optimeringens grundidéer - kunna använda Lagrange multiplikatorer - kunna räkna dubbel- och trippelintegraler - kunna byta integrationsordning i dubbelintegraler - kunna byta variabler i dubbel- och trippelintegraler
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will - know how to calculate approximations with the aid of partial derivatives - be able to solve systems of equations with Newton's method - know and understand the basic ideas of optimization - be able to use Lagrange multipliers - be able to calculate double and triple integrals - be able to change the order of integration in double integrals - know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

content.fi: usean muuttujan funktiot ja niiden derivaatat, usean muuttujan funktion optimointi, taso- ja avaruusintegraalit.
content.sv: funktioner av flera variabler och deras derivator, optimering av funktioner med flera variabler, dubbel- och trippelintegraler.
content.en: functions of several variables and their derivatives, optimization of functions with several variables, double and triple integrals.

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A03XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 3 kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat- 1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Yhdessä joko kurssin MS-A04XX Diskreetin matematiikan perusteet tai kurssin MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat- 1.1120. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2.
substitutes.sv: Tillsammans med kursen MS-A03XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 3 ersätter kurser Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Tillsammans med kursen MS-04XX Grundkurs i diskret matematik eller kursen MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 ersätter kursen Mat-1.1120. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
substitutes.en:
Together with the course MS-A03XX Differential and integral calculus 3 substitutes the courses Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Together with the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics or the course MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1 substitutes the course Mat-1.1110.
Substitutes the courses MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli : suomi Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Kevät III  2023-2024 Kevät III Ilmoittautuminen : Opetukseen ilmoittaudutaan Sisussa (sisu.aalto.fi).

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta, MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A00XX Matrisräkning, MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija ymmärtää lineaarialgbran peruskäsitteet ja hänellä on teoreettinen ymmärrys lineaarisista yhtälöryhmistä, pienimmän neliösumman tehtävistä ja ominaisarvotehtävistä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter fullgjord kurs studenten förstår grundläggande koncept inom linjär algebra och har teoretisk förståelse av linjära system, minsta kvadratmetod och egenvärdesproblem.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the student has obtained an understanding of the basic concepts of linear algebra. He/she has theoretical understanding of linear systems, least squares problems and eigenvalue problems.

content.fi: Lineaariagbran peruskäsitteet. Lineaariset yhtälöryhmät, pienimmän neliösumman ongelmat ja ominaisarvotehtävät.
content.sv: Grundläggande koncept inom linjär algebra. Linjära system, minsta kvadratmetod och egenvärdesproblem.
content.en: Basic theoretical concepts in linear algebra. Linear systems, least squares problems and eigenvalue problems.

substitutes.fi:
Korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1343.




Yhdessä kurssin MS-C1300 Kompleksianalyysi kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1030.




Yhdessä kurssin MS-C1300 Kompleksianalyysi tai kurssin MS-1420 Fourier-analyysi kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.sv:
Kan ersättes med kurser Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1342.
Tillsammans med kursen MS-C1300 Komplex analys ersätter kursen Mat-1.1030.
Tillsammans med kursen MS-C1300 Komplex analys eller MS-1420 Fourier analys ersätter kursen Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.en:
Substitutes the courses Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1342.
Together with the course MS-C1300 Complex analysis substitutes the course Mat-1.1030.
Together with the course MS-C1300 Complex analysis or the course MS-C1420 Fourier analysis substitutes the course Mat-1.1230.

workload.sv: 36 h kontaktundervisning, 95 h självständiga studier.
workload.en: 36 h contact teaching, 95 h independent study.

prerequisites.fi:
PHYS-A0120 Termodynamiikka
PHYS-C0210 Kvanttimekaniikka
prerequisites.sv:
PHYS-A0120 Termodynamiikka (Termodynamik)
PHYS-C0210 Kvanttimekaniikka (Kvantmekanik)
prerequisites.en:
PHYS-A0120 Termodynamiikka (Thermodynamics)
PHYS-C0210 Kvanttimekaniikka (Quantum Mechanics)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
  1. Osaa selittää statistisen fysiikan peruskäsitteet, joita ovat mm. mikro- ja makrotilat, ensemblet (joukot), partitiofunktio, Boltzmannin jakauma ja ekvipartitioteoreema.
  2. Osaa selittää tilastollisista määritelmistä lähtien lämpötilan, entropian ja termodynaamisten potentiaalien käsitteet.
  3. Ymmärtää statistisen fysiikan perusperiaatteen, jonka mukaan systeemin termodynaamisia ominaisuuksia voidaan laskea sen partitiofunktiosta liikkeelle lähtien, ja osaa soveltaa sitä tiettyjen yksinkertaisten systeemien (esim. ideaalikaasu) tapauksessa.
  4. Tuntee kurssilla käsiteltyjen systeemien ja ilmiöiden - ideaalikaasun, fotonien ja kvanttikaasujen - perusominaisuuksia, sekä osaa ratkaista niihin liittyviä yksinkertaisia statistisen fysiikan ongelmia.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Färdigheter som studeranden kan efter att ha erlagt kursen:
  1. Kan förklara de grundläggande begreppen statistisk fysik, som är bland annat mikro- och makrotillståndet, ensembler, partitionsfunktionen, Boltzmannfördelning och ekvipartitions teoremet.
  2. Kan förklara begreppen temperatur, entropi och termodynamisk potential från de statistiska definitionerna.
  3. Förstå den grundläggande principen för statistisk fysik att de termodynamiska egenskaperna hos systemet kan beräknas från dess partitionsfunktion och kan applicera det vid vissa enkla system (t.ex. ideal gas).
  4. Känner till de grundläggande egenskaperna hos de system och fenomen som behandlas av kursen - idealisk gas, fotoner och kvantgaser - såväl som att lösa enkla statistiska fysikens problem.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
  1. Can explain the basic concepts of statistical physics, which include micro- and macrostates, ensembles, partition function, Boltzmann distribution, and equipartition theorem.
  2. Can explain, starting from the statistical definitions, the concepts of temperature, entropy and thermodynamic potentials.
  3. Understands the basic principle of statistical physics, according to which the thermodynamic properties of a system can be derived from its partition function, and can apply this principle in the case of certain simple systems (e.g., ideal gas).
  4. Knows the basic properties of systems and phenomena covered at the course - namely, ideal gas, photons, and quantum gases - and can solve simple statistical physics problems related to them.

content.fi: Statistisen mekaniikan peruskäsitteet ja -oletukset. Kaasujen kineettisen teorian perusteet ja yksinkertaiset kuljetusilmiöt ideaalikaasuissa. Entropia ja termodynaamiset potentiaalit. Ensembleteorian perusteet: mikrokanoninen, kanoninen ja suurkanoninen ensemble. Klassisen ideaalikaasun statistinen mekaniikka. Fotonikaasu ja ideaaliset kvanttikaasut.
content.sv: Grundläggande begrepp och antaganden av statistisk mekanik. Grunderna om kinetisk teori om gaser och enkla transportfenomen i ideal gaser. Entropi och termodynamiska potentialer. Ensembleteori: en mikrokanonisk, kanonisk och storkanonisk ensemble. Klassisk mekanik av klassisk ideal gas. Fotonisk gas. Idealiska kvantgaser.
content.en: The basic concepts and assumptions of statistical mechanics. The basics of the kinetic theory of gases and simple transport phenomena in ideal gases. Entropy and thermodynamic potentials. The basics of ensemble theory: microcanonical, canonical and grand canonical ensemble. The statistical mechanics of the ideal gas. Photon gas. Ideal quantum gases.

assesmentMethods.en: Teaching methods: lectures and exercises. Assessment criteria: pre-lecture assignments, exercises, and exam.

prerequisites.fi: PHYS-C0252 Quantum Mechanics or otherwise corresponding knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: PHYS-C0252 Quantum Mechanics or otherwise corresponding knowledge.
prerequisites.en: PHYS-C0252 Quantum Mechanics or otherwise corresponding knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  1. Can explain the basic concepts of statistical physics, which include micro- and macrostates, ensembles, partition function, Boltzmann distribution, and equipartition theorem.
  2. Can explain, starting from the statistical definitions, the concepts of temperature, entropy and thermodynamic potentials.
  3. Can identify the quantum-mechanical density operator corresponding to a basic quantum system.
  4. Can solve basic master equation for a quantum two-level system.
  5. Applications of quantum thermodynamics: heat transport, thermometry and refrigeration

  3. Can identify the quantum-mechanical density operator corresponding to a basic quantum system.

content.fi: The basic concepts and assumptions of statistical mechanics. The basics of ensemble theory: microcanonical, canonical, and grand canonical ensembles. Entropy, temperature, and thermodynamic potentials. Quantum density operator in statistical physics. Energy dissipation and decoherence of two-level quantum systems from the statistical physics point of view. Introduction to the theory of quantum thermodynamics and applications.
content.sv: The basic concepts and assumptions of statistical mechanics. The basics of ensemble theory: microcanonical, canonical, and grand canonical ensembles. Entropy, temperature, and thermodynamic potentials. Quantum density operator in statistical physics. Energy dissipation and decoherence of two-level quantum systems from the statistical physics point of view. Introduction to the theory of quantum thermodynamics and applications.
content.en: The basic concepts and assumptions of statistical mechanics. The basics of ensemble theory: microcanonical, canonical, and grand canonical ensembles. Entropy, temperature, and thermodynamic potentials. Quantum density operator in statistical physics. Energy dissipation and decoherence of two-level quantum systems from the statistical physics point of view. Introduction to the theory of quantum thermodynamics and applications.

prerequisites.fi: TU-C2010 Introduction to Strategic Management or similar skills and knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: TU-C2010 Introduction to Strategic Management or similar skills and knowledge.
prerequisites.en: TU-C2010 Introduction to Strategic Management or similar skills and knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, participants should have
  • Strengthened their proficiency in established and contemporary concepts, theories, and tools in strategic management of technology and innovation and their ability to apply those in real life,
  • Improved their analytical and prescriptive strategy skills, and
  • Deepened their understanding of different empirical phenomena in strategic management of technology and innovation.
Additionally, participants should have practiced
  • Analytical skills in defining and solving problems and reporting the results in academic manner
  • Reflection skills
  • Group management, coordination, and teamwork skills
  • Communication and presentation skills
This course will be particularly useful if you plan your careers as entrepreneurs, managers responsible for R&D, technology or innovation, or management consultants.

content.fi: As the name states, the course is about strategic management of technology and innovation. It is not about individual technologies as such and takes a broad perspective to technology beyond digitalisation, including, for example, nano, health, and energy technologies. Regarding innovation, course not only covers the ways how firms can profit and capture value, but also explores the concept of open innovation and ways of leveraging external sources. Relatedly, platform economy and its implications to strategic management of technology and innovation are studied extensively. Finally, while the dominating perspective on the course is the performance of a firm, the societal aspect and impacts for sustainability form an important part of the course.
